Deficiency Narrative: Two of the three child records reviewed were observed to have inaccurate information on the children's preliminary service plans.
Correction Narrative: The operation's Administrator emailed copies of the two inaccurate preliminary service plans showing that they have been corrected and now meet individualized needs of the children in care.

Deficiency Narrative: An Unauthorized Absence Log was not available upon request. Operation staff created and provided the log during the investigation inspection.
One of the three employee files reviewed did not have annual Normalcy Training.
Correction Narrative: Copy of Normalcy Training certificate was emailed to inspector.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the three employee files reviewed did  not have documentation of completed Annual EBI Training.
Correction Narrative: Copy of EBI Training Certificate was emailed to inspector.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the three employee files reviewed did not have CPR Certification.
Correction Narrative: Copy of CPR Certification was emailed to inspector.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the three employee files reviewed did not have current annual training for Trauma Informed Care.
Correction Narrative: Copy of training certificate was emailed to inspector.

Deficiency Narrative: Three of the three employee files reviewed were observed to be missing annual trainings on human trafficking victims.
Correction Narrative: Copy of first two hour training certificate for each employee was emailed to inspector. Two hour training to complete 4hr is scheduled for 12/27/21.

Deficiency Narrative: Operation does not have an Annual Summary Log for Unauthorized Absences.
There is no documentation of child orientation being provided to a child in care.
Two child records reviewed did not have a Preliminary Service Plan.
One child's service plan reviewed did not have a signature from PLSP.
Two of the three employee files reviewed did not have documentation of TB screenings.
Operation could not provide documentation of fire or severe weather drills.
Two of the three employee files reviewed did not have an Affidavit for Applicants for Employment form.
One child's service plan reviewed does not have child's signature.
Neither child record reviewed contained information on child orientation-how to make complaints to outside agencies.
Two of the three employee files reviewed did not have proof of diploma.
The operation's last gas inspection occurred 09/28/2018.
Neither of the three child records reviewed showed documentation of a TB exam.
Admission assessments reviewed in child records did not have documentation related to known contraindications to the use of restraints.
Three of three child records reviewed did not provide the child's gender, race, or religion on operation's admission assessment.
One employee file reviewed had an expired CPR certification card.
One of two closed files reviewed did not have a discharge summary for previous child in care.
A caregiver who was counted in ratio did not have current EBI training.
Correction Narrative: The operation has stated that all employees must now complete required trainings prior to being able to work.

Deficiency Narrative: Caregivers failed to adhere to the child's rights to be free of abuse, neglect, and exploitation as defined in Texas Family Code 261.401 when the caregivers failed to intervene during a physical altercation between children, which resulted in a child sustaining a serious injury.
Correction Narrative: The operation has stated that their staff will continue to use verbal de-escalation techniques to intervene in altercations. Staff is also required to acknowledge de-escalation and restraint policies.

Deficiency Narrative: An initial service plan was not conducted on the child. The last service plan completed by the previous operation was dated, 7/30/2020. Child was placed at the operation on 10/29/20.
Correction Narrative: The operation is now ensuring that all plans are completed within 30 days.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff did not intervene when two residents were involved in a physical altercation, leading to one child being  seriously injured.
Correction Narrative: The operation has stated that they will continue to use verbal de-escalation techniques for children in care and require medical attention as a precaution following any physical contact between residents. The operation does not allow restraints.

Deficiency Narrative: Operation did not comply with the request for additional documentation or surveillance video related to the investigation.
Correction Narrative: The operation has ensured that Licensing staff is provided all requested documentation upon request.
